intro: Dichorisandra puberula, commonly known as the silverleaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and bright yellow flowers. The plant has a compact, bushy growth habit and thrives in well-drained soil. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and drought tolerance. Dichorisandra puberula is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
